repnme.cdata!:
Malaysia - Montreal Protocol Ozone
            Depleting Substances Phase Out Investment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Montreal Protocol
            Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) Phase-Out Investment
            Project is to assist the Government in carrying out its
            country program to phase out ODS by implementing
            cost-effective investment subprojects which reduce
            consumption of ODS in Malaysia. The project will support
            about 30 ODS phase-out subprojects to be implemented by ODS
            consuming enterprises during the next three years and to be
            funded under this umbrella project. It will cover major ODS
            use sectors in Malaysia including refrigeration,
            air-conditioning, foams, aerosols, solvents, and halon. The
            first three already approved subprojects will result in the
            phase-out of about 339 metric tons of Ozone Depleting
            Potential (ODP) annually. The project is expected to be
            completed by December 31, 1998.
